SEARCH
Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.service

Klasse MusicPlayer

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.service.MusicPlayer
public class MusicPlayer extends Object
The MusicPlayer class is responsible for handling the playback of background music and sound effects.

It supports continuous playback, single playback, and dynamic volume adjustment for audio files.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • MusicPlayer

      public MusicPlayer()
      Default constructor for the MusicPlayer class.

      This constructor is required to ensure that an explicit constructor is present for documentation purposes. It initializes the audio playback system but does not start playback automatically.

  • Methodendetails

    • playMusic

      public void playMusic(String fileName, float volume, String style)
      Plays a music file in a continuous loop.

      The music file is loaded from the style-specific folder under /sfx/. It validates the input file, sets the volume, and starts playback in a loop.

      Parameter:
      fileName - The name of the audio file to play (e.g., "background-music.wav").
      volume - The desired volume level in decibels (e.g., -30.0f for reduced volume).
      style - The visual style that determines the folder structure (e.g., "retro", "modern").

    • playMusicOnce

      public void playMusicOnce(String fileName, float volume, String style)
      Plays a music file once without looping.

      The music file is loaded from the style-specific folder under /sfx/. It validates the input file, sets the volume, and starts playback for a single iteration.

      Parameter:
      fileName - The name of the audio file to play (e.g., "click-sound.wav").
      volume - The desired volume level in decibels (e.g., -20.0f for reduced volume).
      style - The visual style that determines the folder structure (e.g., "retro", "modern").

    • stopMusic

      public void stopMusic()
      Stops the currently playing music and releases resources.

      This method checks if the music clip is currently running. If so, it stops playback and closes the clip to release system resources.

    • getSoundEffectDuration

      public static double getSoundEffectDuration(String fileName, String style)
      Retrieves the duration of a sound effect in seconds.

      This method calculates the duration of an audio file by dividing its total frame count by the audio format's frame rate. If any error occurs while accessing the audio file, the method logs the error and returns a duration of 0.0.

      Parameter:
      fileName - The name of the sound effect file (without extension).
      style - The visual/audio style folder where the sound effect is located.
      Gibt zurück:
      The duration of the sound effect in seconds, or 0.0 if an error occurs.
